danaus

Class GUIButterfly

  • java.lang.Object
    • danaus.GUIButterfly
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class GUIButterfly
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    An instance represents an animated butterfly. Inspiration and information for writing this class was taken heavily from http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/components/slider.html

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int EAST_INDEX 
      static int NORTH_INDEX
      indices into the array of flapping frames.

      static int WEST_INDEX 
      float xTopLeft
      The x coordinate of the Butterfly's top left point.
      float yTopLeft
      The y coordinate of the Butterfly's top left point.

      Constructor and Description
      GUIButterfly(GUIMap map, int width, int height)
      Constructor: an instance on map map with width width and height height.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)

      Draws the butterfly at top-left position (x, y) using graphics g.

      If a move is occurring, add addend to the move count.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(int s,
        Direction d,
        int toRow,
        int toCol,
        int sideLength)
        Move the butterfly to row-column (toRow, toCol) with speed s and in direction d. sideLength is the length of a side of the map's tiles.

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        True if the butterfly is moving.

      • moveAdd

        public void moveAdd(int addend)
        If a move is occurring, add addend to the move count.

      • nudge

        public void nudge(float dx,
         float dy)
        Nudges the butterfly's position along by (dx, dy)

      • updateFPM

        public void updateFPM(int fpm)
        Change the butterfly's fpm to fpm. This is triggered by the fps slider at the top of the GUI.

      • getTopLeft

        public java.awt.Point getTopLeft()
        Returns the top left corner of the butterfly.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
        int xTopLeft,
        int yTopLeft)
        Draws the butterfly at top-left position (x, y) using graphics g. The butterfly is told where to be drawn because it doesn't know if it's in the phantom zone or not.

      • getFrame

        public java.awt.Image getFrame()
        Returns the current frame in the flap animation.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Increment the frame. Triggered by the flap timer.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
